content:
0, 2016
Product received for free
												No, Witcher 3 and Skyrim it isn't. But the game doesn't take itself so seriously as to aspire to such hefty goals to begin with. It instead has the goal of simply having fun with the action/adventure genre. I would likely recommend this game for parents who sometimes struggle to find appropriate content for their kids on Steam (like I do). And it's kid-tested, as both my daughters (age 8 and 11) gave it a play. The graphics may not be spectacular, but they are as colorful and inviting as a Saturday morning cartoon. The characters are likable, and fully voiced, which adds a nice touch. The blood-free battle system is incredibly easy to use, requiring virtually no technical skill. The fairytale story is simple to follow and goals are easy to understand. Overall, it's an entertaining (though a tad oversimplified for the older set) game appropriate for all ages.

content:
7, 2016
Product received for free
												For the LOLs!!!I have been thinking for quite a while whether I should give this one a thumbs up. Actually I've been thinking so hard about this review that I couldn't sleep well at night and dreamt about this game XDTruth be told it is quite crappy at times. Voice acting is so off it is funny!  Same goes for the script, even though that is intentional by the devs. (Just think about those crappy B or even C movies that are so bad they are fun again)While the game does run stable and never crashed on me, there are some glitches. Most annoying one is the Archer, as whom you start playing. Sometimes it just won't hit, especially when your target is close to a tree or in a partly covered position as are enemy archers at the beginning of the 2nd area. However it is not too much of an issue, because enemies don't do that much damage and there is quite an abundance of health items.Graphics are nice to behold and go easy on the eyes. Quests are always clear, including objective markers on the map.Overall I can recommend this game on a sale, when you are looking for something crappy yet strangly enough entertaining in a funny way (or maybe it's just me and my way off humor!).

content:
ber 10, 2016
												Uncertain why are there so many short and negative reviews,complaints about the game crashing, unable to start etc...Had no problem at all.Gameplay is rather smooth and fluid.Graphics are bright, colourful and well drawn.Dialogues and short-scenes are actually well done and entertaining.Switching between campanions to utilize the playstyle in different situation or encounters.Stationing the meleer behind a bush, using the archer to shoot the enemy archer and lure the others towards the bush for the meleer to engage.Having a fine time, although there are minor issues with crosshair and aiming being the archer.Achievements require replaying the characters to attain.Starting the game in Hard mode gives more experience per enemy,does speed up the process of getting enough skill points.It is easy to attain every skill achievements individually by playing carefully for the first three maps, using the heroe's initial skill such as Aimed Shot and Thunderclap, gather Experience skill to 5-7 points and saving at intervals.with enough Skill Points to level up the furthest skill, max out the skill individually by reloading the save and allocating the skill points.Understand the story missions are rather short and few, could use more updates and expansions to widen the game.Could easily be a greater game,which is a pity.Initially just thought of purchasing for the purpose of Achievements and Trading Cards.Now I do feel its a proper buy.Recommend to play if the price is low.

number of helpful: 21 of 24 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
7
												I received this game for free from Free Games. It is a comedy action RPG featuring an archer Alesha, a staff fighter Dobrynya and a sword and shield fighter Ilya who decided to band up together to help the nearby farmers and villagers with wild animal and bandit problems. This game is easy to finish, with an estimated playtime of 10 hours provided skillpoints are not used until a game save is made and the save is used to obtain all the 3-star achievements for each character's skill. Combat is simple and easy for most of the game where each character's normal attack is enough to defeat most enemies. Some of the fights get a bit more difficult where Dobrynya is at an obvious disadvantage against archers and sword and shield enemies who can strike very fast and slow him down. Most of the skills in all 3 characters are also not very useful, with only a few skills that are really needed to raise to 3 stars to win certain types and groups of enemies. Furthermore, when the other 2 heroes are following the controlled character, their AI could be better in helping to defend the player from enemies attacking them from behind. Quests have sufficient variety and humour. Although all quests have objective markers shown clearly on the game map, some quests become impossible to progress and complete due to faulty NPC AI pathfinding. Graphics and soundtracks are decent. Recommended when at discount or bundle offer as the game has a few bugs that might be annoying.

number of helpful: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
y 18
Product received for free
-Quick Review-Three Heroes is a short indie-RPG developed by Cats Who Play and released Sep 16, 2015.


Uncanny Valley, here we come! 
A Screenshot of Three Heroes
By: Atratzu




-Detailed breakdown review-Story: You basically have a fairy tail start, the archer and hero Alesha has come out of retirement because bandits attacked him and he turned them into pincushions. (A sentiment I can respect, being an avid ranger/hunter/marksman/bowman main in other video games.)He goes to get the help of his two other friends Dobrynya who fights with a staff weapon, and Ilya whom fights with the bread and butter: sword and shield.Gameplay: Each Hero has a different fighting style, and a set of talents they can choose between while leveling up. Experience is granted from kills and completing quests. Just a pro tip right now: You cannot unlock all of the skills to max in a play through, so choose wisely. (ACHIEVER NOTICE if you're going for the achievements, save up your skill points before you spend them. Then save before hand and then reload to get the achievements. Also there are tons of auto saves, so even if you miss something you can reload the level you missed.)


Skill Tree. You can get the achievements easy by saving up skill points, saving them spending them all and reloading. 
A Screenshot of Three Heroes
By: Atratzu




As a whole, I didn't find the game to be too unpleasantness, for the first hour or so Three Heroes is very entertaining! But then you start to feel like somethings not quite right... It starts with the awkwardness of the controls. Don't jump... just don't. it slows you down, the only time you'll use it is if you're stuck on something. Also you cannot move and attack (which is agony for someone who loves to kite in video games).Lastly the music gets a bit repetitive (so I turned it off), and the voice acting is borderlines awkward and annoying, and awkward and funny. It's right inbetween.The 3d models are rough around the edges, and one of my favorite effects, is when you use a special pole vaulting animation with Dodrynya, when after he launches himself HE RAGDOLLS when he hits the floor. It's hilarious, I love it!


Hey guys, no swimming allowed. 
A Screenshot of Three Heroes
By: Atratzu




Conclusion: So here's the thing... I've played some games which are right in between being good and bad and I decide I think they're bad because they weren't interesting, or had mechanical problems which took me out of the game.This game is definitely in between, some mechanical things should be ironed out. But It's clear the developers are actually trying. Each character is distinct and different and has different controls. (And making a whole 3d game as an indie team? it's pretty uncommon to make a game which feels like it came out of the Play Station 2. Most indie dev's will make an RPG maker for the hundreth time, or go a pixil art so they don't need to 3d model or program as hard.Kudos to  Cats Who Play for actually taking this route with their game. It won't appeal to everyone, some people will probably hate their game. But as long as I can recognize the good with the bad, I enjoyed my time with the game, it didn't over stay its welcome, and if you're looking to support an indie dev, go ahead and give Three Heroes a try.Thank you for reading, as always I'm Atratzu and I approve this review.

content:
9, 2016
												MOTHER RUSSIA. HEROS OF RUSSIA. This game is a cultural history lesson on Russian mythology. or Slavic to be exact. The Mother land is under attack by bandits and ruffians and well just badguys.  Starting with the archer hero Alesha you join up with the other 2 heros by doing missions and learning the diffrent fighting styles of each hero. Illya is a sword and sheild kinda guy and Domrynya is a ''shaft'' its is called, user. Collect weapons and items in true RPG style sence and level up the heros to fight and get rid of the filth in the Motherland. Full of missions/quests on maps or areas to complete with lots of story. Switiching between heros and using their unique abilities is key to some of the missions. It makes it puzzle like sometimes. A little gimic with the usage of 3 main characters. I like. They will kill and maim all bandits eventually. They shall find a way .... I think that that cool part of the game is the cultural story of telling you or giving you an idea what these Slavic myth heros were suppose to be like. The music is on que with the cultural and diffrent but enjoyable and the graphic art style is well artsy. ''Comic '' like. This isnt all dark and grimy like The Witcher or Darksiders solo RPGs. Its a good intro for upcoming video gamers like my own 10 year old for exp. Thel get into it and learn how these games work. I enjoyed it and I think if your a fan of Gilgamesh or Hercules mythology with a Fable like feel. GO FOR IT.

content:
y 20
												I bought this game because it looked good, I was looking for a casual game to play, and it was cheap.  As I read reviews, the biggest complaint was that controls were terrible and it was really hard to actually hit enemies.  I also noted that players making such claims had generally logged under 1/2 an hour of play time.  I now have 13+ hrs of game play and rest assured, once you get a better bow, targeting gets much better, plus your special abilities also make it easier to hit and kill enemies.  Another complaint is that the voice acting is terrible and that the translation from Russian to English is pathetic.  Although it's true, I'm actually finding it endearing.  It actually fits the game, the graphics, and the story.  It's quite funny!  In terms of game play, it isn't just hack and slash.  There is definitely some strategy involved as the authors have created situations in which you can't simply charge in.  There are also some non-fighting puzzles involved.  I heartily recommend this game (4 out of 5 stars).  It's fun, funny, and the plot is fairly interesting (based on a Russian fairy tale) with casual game play so you can play for 15 minutes or 5 hours at a time.

												Although the game is pretty and I wanted to like the idea of it, I didn't get on with it very well. I found getting stuck on invisible scenery and on other characters who won't move to be highly frustrating as well as the target system and just how terrible the bow plays. I had a lot of random instant deaths for no reason (such as after a cut scene for a conversation) or how if you touch water it instantly kills you as well. It seems to be bugged if you can enter it or not. If you die, you have to start from your last save which you have to manually do so and if you forget - you start from the beginning again. Pressing the hot keys for controls randomly stops working (such as being unable to bring up the map). Mobs behave randomly. I was mauled instantly by an entire group of wolves after a cut scene. Next try they ran at me one by one. Had the same issue with a quest to kill some boars. The game also decides to end your go for you because it doesn't like you being close to the bandits rather than letting you have a chance against them. Felt very forced.Too many bugs and a very annoying combat targetting system which just makes the game frustrating to play, rather than enjoyable.

Product received for free
												First Impressions:I was actually suprised by the general quality of the game in some areas. The graphics in particular are pretty and colorful really bringing alive this Russian folk lore theme they seem to be going for. I also find the music is pretty decent but it gets pretty repetitive after awhile. There is not any major bugs or glitches that I have experienced yet either. The game also ran very well for me. The combat is not terrible, but the major problem I have with it is the lack of feedback. There is not hit SFX making all the combat feel pretty lame. It is a shame really because besides that I thought the combat was pretty ok. You can use a variety of different moves that have different uses and you can switch characters for certain circumstances. I really feel that they can patch some SFX in or something to improve this. Also I am not sure if this is possible but I feel the game would be better with Russian voice acting because as it is the English voice acting is terrible. It really takes away from the overall feel of the game. If they can add combat hit SFX and Russian voice acting with English sub I feel this can really be a pretty decent game. I can really tell the devs actually put some effort into this one which is not always the case with indie games on steam. Also it is a fairly unique concept as well which is cool to see.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
18, 2016
Product received for free
												I was gifted a copy of Fairy Tales: Three Heroes for review purposes by the Steam entity, Epic Quest Games or "EQ Free Games."  It's so neat to see videogames based directly on a cultural history/mythology (Slavic).  I once took a course on Russian folklore & found some familiar elements here.  Tragically, every other aspect of the game (aside from art) is a letdown.Before now I'd never heard of Cats Who Play or any game they've developed.  Probably won't go for more of their stuff until I see ample proof of their improvement with time & experience - & I'm speaking as a gamer with a wide-ranging appetite for indie creations.  On paper the concept is great: three distinct heroes, an adventure & a villain all inspired by Russian lore/history.  Unique skills & mechanics for each hero.  Something was lost in transition from concept to game.Clearly skills & targeting don't work as well as they ought.  Auto-aim penalties & poor responsiveness in player controls render investment of points into certain skill trees a waste.  The entire experience of player movement, jumping, strafing, pathfinding, etcetera is as clumsy as the combat.  Nothing is intuitive; gameplay is at times painfully dreary.Triggers for cutscenes & events are occasionally misplaced, leading to events being out of sequence.  It'd be hilarious if I weren't actually trying to finish the level.  A few bugs caused crashes, or led to inconveniences like a missing mouse pointer or launch failure.  This doesn't alt+tab well at all, either.I played on Normal, given the choice of Easy, Normal or Hard.  Doesn't matter all too much since combat is wonky; hitting enemies & surviving battle depends as much on whatever's happening behind the scenes as on your input!Localization in English is fairly poor.  Grammar errors, laughably awkward voice acting, misspelled or entirely incorrect subtitles.  It just took me out of the moment.  The art style is quite pleasant - very bright & colorful with clean lines.  The music seems fine for a low budget indie; I'd say low to middling visual/audio production quality.And yet after all this, I still found the will to play all the way through to the end.  My first attempt wasn't great.  I came back a few days later & willed myself to finish the game in one full evening of play.  Conceptually it isn't bad at all!  The game's just rudimentary in so many ways that it is at no point a compelling experience.  The single gratifying moment for me was seeing how Hero-specific mechanics were worked into completing an objective that utilized the folklore stuff.  I won't spoil it.I don't want to be too harsh in my review; I respect the effort that goes into creating even a small game.  With design tweaks & significant technical overhaul I'd happily play, on whichever platform.  Unfortunately I can't currently recommend Fairy Tales: Three Heroes.  A shame, as I was curious at the outset to see what could be done with the folklore angle.

content:
y 20
												Fairy Tales: Three Heroes is an action-adventure game featuring cartoon-styled visuals and easy-to-learn gameplay. Play with three characters of famous epic stories, each with unique skills. As the player, you control one hero while the two others accompany him. At any time, the player can change for another hero and control him. You can improve the skills from level to level, and also provide the party with new weapons and equipment. There are four different regions in the game, each with different environments and different villains. 5/10 very good for indie.

												How about instead of making a review, I just tell you my game-experience:As you start you notice the broken english and horrid VO right away. It attempts to be funny, but gets horribly down due to that (and the gameplay, but we get to that later).You start as a bowman, with a bow. You know... those weapons where you almost have to crawl into somebody to hit anything? Yeah, I didn't know bows required that either, but you do here. Gameplay pretty much consists of walking backwards and killing things point blank.Then I got a few quests. I found someone who wanted 2 guards to ambush a bandit camp. After finding the guards I also found the camp and killed them all. No "camp is already slayed" dialogue, nope, all enemies just respawned instead. One of the enemies is a bowman, who also uses hit-and-run and has as horrid an accuracy as you do. So the best way to fight them without having to run the entire map is find an open spot (since pretty much everything can intercept your arrows) and then just wham away at each other for about a minute till the other is dead (since they can't hit you either, *and* your hp regenerates).Killing it it dropped a +55 damage bow... sweet. Except it also reduces speed by 30. The default speed is... uhm... slugh, and there's no sprinting. NO, WHY? WHY? Why would you want us to go even slower? I want faster, not slower dammit... well, guess it's keeping to killing slowly too but atleast walking slow, just not uber-slow.There also was another quest to gather 3 parts to get a better bow, but the questgiver just said he would "meet me later"... guess what... nothing at all.Cue area 2.Here you get a melee guy. Not much different since you pretty much meleed already but atleast he has AoE and a decent attack speed, making it all the less annoying to play. Weren't it that melee hits interrupt animations (including attacks and specials) so most of your hits get interrupted, and using your special is pretty much not done unless they're chasing down your AI ally who's fleeing again like a bowman all over the map... ugh.This area starts with sheer horror as you need to kill 4 bowman in towers. Behind some kind of wooden shield. Yup, have fun going 2 minutes each to kill them just missing 90% of your shots.So learning about the bandit camp I went in, bad move, instant gameover. Didn't save, had to re-do archers... NOOOO. Anyway if you want to play this game, save often, you never know when you just get insta-game-overs.Finding the appropriate spots, running so sloooowly around, murdered another full camp, had to jump over water... missed. You guessed it, insta-game over. Second time it worked but upon returning it triggered a cutscene and my char was stuck in the ground halfway during it. No biggie I thought, nope. Insta-game-over.Succeeding, you need to walk to point X, then ALL THE WAY around the camp (soooooo sloooooow) to point Y, then X again (WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY?). Supposedly I was supposed to force my AI to stay there but I didn't so the cutscenes got really funny with a non-existant talker, and in the end my archer just was amongst the enemies chilling they did nothing when he shot all lumber bars ontop himself too, but he survived while all around him died. Did I mention this game is buggy?The villagers were happy, they were saved, they wanted me to kill a stronghold. Wait, the one before? Yup, indeed. Again, everything just respawned once more, aside from 2 tower guards (thank god with how bow gameplay works).After that area was over besides 2 sidequests which required me to jump water again and walk alot (failed once, insta-gameover) and one that forces you to hunt bunnies around the whole map (did I mention a lot of slllllllllllllllow walking).The rewards? More weapons with speed penalties! AAAAAAAAAaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh.Why? Why? WHY?This game could be fun, the humour is there, but the horrid gameplay, the slowness (even without -slow weaponry, and ALL weaponry has that), bad translation and even worse VO completely wreck it's neck. Let's start by removing -slow from weapons devs, please?

content:
20
												This is quite simple action RPG. The missions are basics, the skill trees are sufficient, graphic is handmade and this is where game is beginning to have it's charm, throw into it a great vile of humour and sale all this for 2 Euro and you'll have a winner. There are few flows I've noticed but nothing very major. Firstly some missions are a bit frustrating. Some needs synchronization between heroes and this is sometimes hard to accomplish, secondly a "schaft-man" seems the weakest of all, very week against archers and not so good at melee, thirdly I played most time with Aloyasha (you know the bowman) and the rest of the party successfully blocked me from retreating so I died few times because of that, also I ware missing quick-save option. Overall it is a positive experience, and since one can get it around 0,3$ at sales I found this one of best investments. At the end small tip, save yourself some frustration and invest few points at aimed arrow and at pole jump.

content:
y 13
												I came across a chicken who was like no other. This chicken had the ability to moonwalk, and it did so while sliding across the entire field of crops on my tiny yard. Seriously, why was my yard so tiny? I had a whole forest around me to expand into, but I guess I was just lazy. I walked over to the chicken and tried to pick it up, but to no avail, as I couldn't bend over! I tried to shooting the chicken, but then I realized I had the worst aim with a bow and proceeded to fire the arrow into the nearby river. I was still in awe over the Chicken's ability to do both a backwards slide, but I had no way to transport him. I proceeded to kick the chicken, and it made the chicken run towards the river. I chased after the flightless bird, but my stubby legs could not keep up. It ran into a tree and proceeded to slide around the tree, so I kicked it again. It began to run towards the river! I stood in terror as I hopelessly watched the chicken go on the shore, and slowly become submerged in the water. I could faintly hear its last clucks before no more bubbles came up from the water.Rating - 420 Sliding Chickens, would definitely abuse animals and cause them to commit suicide again.

content:
y 17
												Cheap game but surprisingly good for its price.Of course it has some advantages and disadvantages:+Graphics are good they add that special atmosphere to this game.+Four game soundtracks that play in the background+That RPG style+Different skills for different situations+Game forces the player to think sometimes (for eg prepare an ambush)+Items have bonuses (for eg accuracy etc)+The enemy's (bandit's) AI is ok.+The obstacles block enemy's shots as well as yours+You can command your heroes to stay/go with you+Easy steam cards+Easy Achievements-Bandit's can go through obstacles while you are blocked by small rock and can't jump over it.-Archers at early stages of the game are the worst thing i have seen. (you'd better go rush someone with a sword than shoot him million times... its like you watch 2 archers collide and noone can hit anything even with skills)-NPC's are stupid they go towards the enemy when u want to protect them.. they die in 6 hits...-You must save everytime you do something... doing a quest fail...(watch above) you start from the beginning.-There is only 19 bandits in their camp and game forces you to prepare an ambush... "we cant fight them all without 3rd hero" while u just destroyed 40 of them before with ease...-Rabbits or hares whatever they are... They just get stuck in a rock (glitch) and you look for the last one for 15 mins... and finnaly you see the last one or i shall say his ear...-When you use your 2nd hero jumping skill he jumps like a retard... he doesnt land on feet... but on the head instead..-When you use your 2nd hero jumping skill he sometimes will slip into water... game over...-You cant step in water ... or fall in it.. supposedly our heroes can't swim.. what (?)-Soundtrack gets boring after 15mins-If you get stuck between bandit's even your 3rd hero won't help you (stunned)I think thats all if i find something more i will keep you updated...Overall 7,8/10 becouse of its price.
